FuncDef:
The diameter-dwr command configures the number of dog-watch-request (DWR) probe packet retransmissions and a probe timeout period.
The undo diameter-dwr command restores the default configuration.
The default number of DWR probe packet retransmissions is 3, and the default probe timeout period is 15s.
By default,the number of DWR probe packet retransmissions is 3, and the default probe timeout period is 15s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of DWR probe packet retransmissions.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 5. The default value is 3.

Configures a probe timeout period.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 25, in seconds. The default value is 15.

Examples: Info: This process may take a few minutes, please wait......OK!
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The number of DWR probe packet retransmissions is fixed at 3, and the probe timeout period is fixed at 15s, to flexibly configure the number of DWR probe packet retransmissions and a probe timeout period, run the diameter-dwr command.
Prerequisites
Diameter must be enabled for the diameter-dwr command to take effect.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
